  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. #include "caml/gc_stats.h"
  19. #include "caml/minor_gc.h"
  20. #include "caml/shared_heap.h"

  22. ‌Caml_inline intnat intnat_max(intnat a, intnat b) {
  23.   return (a > b ? a : b);
  24. }

  26. ‌void caml_accum_heap_stats(struct heap_stats* acc, const struct heap_stats* h)
  27. {
  28.   acc->pool_words += h->pool_words;
  29.   acc->pool_max_words = intnat_max(acc->pool_max_words, acc->pool_words);
  30.   acc->pool_max_words = intnat_max(acc->pool_max_words, h->pool_max_words);
  31.   acc->pool_live_words += h->pool_live_words;
  32.   acc->pool_live_blocks += h->pool_live_blocks;
  33.   acc->pool_frag_words += h->pool_frag_words;
  34.   acc->large_words += h->large_words;
  35.   acc->large_max_words = intnat_max(acc->large_max_words, acc->large_words);
  36.   acc->large_max_words = intnat_max(acc->large_max_words, h->large_max_words);
  37.   acc->large_blocks += h->large_blocks;
  38. }

  40. ‌void caml_remove_heap_stats(struct heap_stats* acc, const struct heap_stats* h)
  41. {
  42.   acc->pool_words -= h->pool_words;
  43.   acc->pool_live_words -= h->pool_live_words;
  44.   acc->pool_live_blocks -= h->pool_live_blocks;
  45.   acc->pool_frag_words -= h->pool_frag_words;
  46.   acc->large_words -= h->large_words;
  47.   acc->large_blocks -= h->large_blocks;
  48. }

  50. ‌void caml_accum_alloc_stats(
  51.   struct alloc_stats* acc,
  52.   const struct alloc_stats* s)
  53. {
  54.   acc->minor_words += s->minor_words;
  55.   acc->promoted_words += s->promoted_words;
  56.   acc->major_words += s->major_words;
  57.   acc->forced_major_collections += s->forced_major_collections;
  58. }

  60. ‌void caml_collect_alloc_stats_sample(
  61.   caml_domain_state *local,
  62.   struct alloc_stats *sample)
  63. {
  64.   sample->minor_words = local->stat_minor_words;
  65.   sample->promoted_words = local->stat_promoted_words;
  66.   sample->major_words = local->stat_major_words;
  67.   sample->forced_major_collections = local->stat_forced_major_collections;
  68. }

  70. ‌void caml_reset_domain_alloc_stats(caml_domain_state *local)
  71. {
  72.   local->stat_minor_words = 0;
  73.   local->stat_promoted_words = 0;
  74.   local->stat_major_words = 0;
  75.   local->stat_forced_major_collections = 0;
  76. }


  79. /* We handle orphaning allocation stats here,
  80.    whereas orphaning of heap stats is done in shared_heap.c */
  81. ‌static caml_plat_mutex orphan_lock = CAML_PLAT_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
  82. ‌static struct alloc_stats orphaned_alloc_stats = {0,};

  84. ‌void caml_accum_orphan_alloc_stats(struct alloc_stats *acc) {
  85.   caml_plat_lock(&orphan_lock);
  86.   caml_accum_alloc_stats(acc, &orphaned_alloc_stats);
  87.   caml_plat_unlock(&orphan_lock);
  88. }

  90. ‌void caml_orphan_alloc_stats(caml_domain_state *domain) {
  91.   struct alloc_stats alloc_stats;

  93.   /* move alloc stats from the domain to [alloc_stats] */
  94.   caml_collect_alloc_stats_sample(domain, &alloc_stats);
  95.   caml_reset_domain_alloc_stats(domain);

  97.   /* push them into the orphan stats */
  98.   caml_plat_lock(&orphan_lock);
  99.   caml_accum_alloc_stats(&orphaned_alloc_stats, &alloc_stats);
  100.   caml_plat_unlock(&orphan_lock);
  101. }


  104. /* The "sampled stats" of a domain are a recent copy of its
  105.    domain-local stats, accessed without synchronization and only
  106.    updated ("sampled") during stop-the-world events -- each minor
  107.    collection, and on domain termination. */
  108. ‌static struct gc_stats sampled_gc_stats[Max_domains];

  110. /* Update the sampled stats for the given domain. */
  111. ‌void caml_collect_gc_stats_sample(caml_domain_state* domain)
  112. {
  113.   struct gc_stats* stats = &sampled_gc_stats[domain->id];
  114.   caml_collect_alloc_stats_sample(domain, &stats->alloc_stats);
  115.   caml_collect_heap_stats_sample(domain->shared_heap, &stats->heap_stats);
  116. }

  118. ‌void caml_clear_gc_stats_sample(caml_domain_state *domain) {
  119.   struct gc_stats* stats = &sampled_gc_stats[domain->id];
  120.   memset(stats, 0, sizeof(*stats));
  121. }

  123. /* Compute global stats for the whole runtime. */
  124. ‌void caml_compute_gc_stats(struct gc_stats* buf)
  125. {
  126.   int i;
  127.   intnat pool_max = 0, large_max = 0;
  128.   int my_id = Caml_state->id;
  129.   memset(buf, 0, sizeof(*buf));

  131.   caml_accum_orphan_heap_stats(&buf->heap_stats);
  132.   caml_accum_orphan_alloc_stats(&buf->alloc_stats);

  134.   /* The instantaneous maximum heap size cannot be computed
  135.      from per-domain statistics, and would be very expensive
  136.      to maintain directly. Here, we just sum the per-domain
  137.      maxima, which is completely wrong.

  139.      FIXME: maybe maintain coarse global maxima?

  141.      The summation starts here from the orphan-heap maxima.
  142.   */
  143.   pool_max = buf->heap_stats.pool_max_words;
  144.   large_max = buf->heap_stats.large_max_words;

  146.   for (i=0; i<Max_domains; i++) {
  147.     /* For allocation stats, we use the live stats of the current domain
  148.        and the sampled stats of other domains.

  150.        For the heap stats, we always used the sampled stats. */
  151.     struct gc_stats* s = &sampled_gc_stats[i];
  152.     if (i != my_id) {
  153.       caml_accum_alloc_stats(&buf->alloc_stats, &s->alloc_stats);
  154.       caml_accum_heap_stats(&buf->heap_stats, &s->heap_stats);
  155.     }
  156.     else {
  157.       struct alloc_stats alloc_stats;
  158.       caml_collect_alloc_stats_sample(Caml_state, &alloc_stats);
  159.       caml_accum_alloc_stats(&buf->alloc_stats, &alloc_stats);
  160.       caml_accum_heap_stats(&buf->heap_stats, &s->heap_stats);
  161.       //FIXME use live heap stats instead of sampled heap stats below?
  162.     }
  163.     pool_max += s->heap_stats.pool_max_words;
  164.     large_max += s->heap_stats.large_max_words;
  165.   }
  166.   buf->heap_stats.pool_max_words = pool_max;
  167.   buf->heap_stats.large_max_words = large_max;
  168. }
